t:
She holds the book in her trembling hands,
A forbidden treasure in a land of lies.
She opens the pages and breathes in the words,
Stories of love and hope and freedom.
She reads in secret, hiding from the eyes
Of those who would burn her book and her dreams.
c:
Why do they fear the power of the pen?
Why do they censor what she wants to read?
She wonders as she turns the pages faster,
Feeling a connection with the author,
A voice that speaks to her across the years.
A voice that was silenced by tyranny and fear.

She closes the book and wraps it in a cloth,
Hiding it under her pillow and sleeps.
She dreams of a world where books can float,
Where words can fly and minds can soar.
She wakes up to the sound of knocking on the door,
Knowing they have come for her and her book.

She grabs it and runs, hoping to escape.
She reaches the river and sees a boat.
She jumps in and throws the book in the air.
It floats above the water, shining in the moonlight.
She smiles and waves, knowing it is free.
She dives into the water, ready to face her fate.
